Package br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder

Class AbstractTimingThreadBuilder<S,​T,​U extends AbstractTimingThreadBuilder<S,​T,​U>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder.AbstractThreadBuilder<S,​T,​U>
      • br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder.AbstractTimingThreadBuilder<S,​T,​U>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - the type of the object resulting from the execution of the thread.
    T - Execution type. Runnable, Callable.
    U - Builder. The Builder extending AbstractThreadBuilder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TimingCallableThreadBuilder, TimingRunnableThreadBuilder
    public abstract class AbstractTimingThreadBuilder<S,​T,​U extends AbstractTimingThreadBuilder<S,​T,​U>>
extends AbstractThreadBuilder<S,​T,​U>
    Abstraction for building threads with the main timing configuration options: Delay, Interval, Timeout.
    Since:
    2020-06-22 V1.1.0 (JDK 1.8)
    See Also:
    AbstractThreadBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • setTimeout

        public U setTimeout​(long milliseconds)
        Sets the timeout value.
        The thread will have a timeout to complete its execution. After that time the thread will be canceled(Future.cancel(boolean)).
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - the timeout value in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the current thread builder.
        See Also:
        setMayInterruptIfRunning(boolean)

      • setDelay

        public U setDelay​(long milliseconds)
        Sets the delay value.
        The thread will wait a predefined time before starting its execution.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - the delay value in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the current thread builder.

      • setInterval

        public U setInterval​(long milliseconds)
        Sets the repeating interval value.
        The thread will repeat its execution, waiting a predefined time before each new execution.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - the repeating interval value in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the current thread builder.

      • setMayInterruptIfRunning

        public U setMayInterruptIfRunning​(boolean flag)
        Sets the thread-interrupting-flag.
        It is used during execution of cancellation by timeout feature. The timeout feature uses a dedicated and secondary thread to perform the cancellation of the primary thread. Note: the primary thread is the one that has been configured with the timeout feature.
        Parameters:
        flag - true if the thread executing this task should be interrupted; otherwise, in-progress tasks are allowed to complete.
        Returns:
        the current thread builder.
        See Also:
        Future.cancel(boolean)

      • schedule

        protected java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<S> schedule​(long delay,
                                                           java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        It schedules the thread, configuring the delay parameter.
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay before thread execution.
        unit - the time unit of the delay.
        Returns:
        the scheduled-future-object of the thread.
        See Also:
        ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.schedule(Callable, long, TimeUnit), ScheduledFuture

      • scheduleAtFixedRate

        protected java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<S> scheduleAtFixedRate​(long delay,
                                                                      long period,
                                                                      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        It schedules the thread, configuring the delay and period parameters.
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay before thread execution.
        period - the interval between thread executions.
        unit - the time unit of the delay and period.
        Returns:
        the scheduled-future-object of the thread.
        See Also:
        ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.scheduleAtFixedRate(Runnable, long, long, TimeUnit), ScheduledFuture
